heading: This Afternoon
text: Mostly to partly sunny north and east of Interstate 89. Partly to mostly cloudy south and west of I-89, and in New York, with a rising chance of snow from the Hudson Valley into areas near and south of the Massachusetts border; snow could mix with rain in the valleys; a trace to an inch of snow, mainly over high terrain. Valley temperatures from the mid 30s to around 40 south, and upper 20s to mid 30s north. North winds 5 to 10 mph, gusting to 20 mph in the Champlain Valley.

heading: Tonight
text: Mostly to partly cloudy, except mainly clear northeast. Any mix changing to snow from the Hudson Valley and Route 9 southward, and in far southern New Hampshire, with 1 to 3 inches. Lows 5 to 15 above, north to south, except some upper teens southwest, northeastern cold hollows around zero. Winds remaining light, variable to north, except from the north at 5 to 10 mph in the Champlain Valley.

heading: Thursday
text: Partly to mostly sunny. Highs in the mid to upper 30s in the south, and upper 20s to mid 30s north. Light and variable winds in the south, light from the north in northern areas, except 5 to 10 mph in the Champlain and St. Lawrence valleys.
